name: header.vim
summary: Adds a header -author, path, timestamp- when a new file is created.
description: When a new file is created the plugin inserts automatically a customizable header on the top -filetype, author, timestamp-. When the file it's no new -so it's already created- the plugin checks the 'last modified' field in line number five -if this exists- and then it updates its value. It's my first vim plugin and it's very plain -I beg pardon to vim's gurus for my daring!- I didn't find anything alike, so I had to write my own script. Any correction or modification will be welcome.
install_details: Easy! Copy the file to vim's plugin directory (global or personal) and run vim.
